eadheader.eadid: PUBLIC "-//American Philosophical Society Library//TEXT(US::PAAV::509 L56:: Scientists Collection)//EN" "letters.xml"

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T18:15-0400

did.abstract:
The Scientists Collection is comprised of individual letters and small groups of correspondence from American, British, French, and German scientists during the past three centuries. Although the content is highly varied, there is significant strength in astronomy, natural history, conchology, and geology.
Among the scientists better represented in the collection are the astronomers William Radcliffe Birt, J.F.W. Herschel, and Franz Xaver von Zach; the conchologists A.D. Brown, Fred L. Button, Otto Mörch, Alfred Newton, Christian M. Poulsen, Temple Prime, Benjamin Lewis Vulliamy, and A. G. Wetherby; the physical scientists George Biddell Airy, Arnold Sommerfeld, Ferdinand R. Hassler, and Max Planck; the archaeologist Jean François Nadaillac; the philosopher William Whewell; and the naturalists Walter Henry Bates, Robert Chambers, Edme Dupuget, Robert Kaye Greville, Joseph Henry, John Stevens Henslow, John Lubbock, and Herbert Spencer.
did.physloc: LH-MV-B-11; LH-SB-Black Case-15 (509 L56.24, 509 L56.f; OS)

odd.head: Naval History Note
odd.p: The Scientists Collection contains at least one item which may be of interest to naval historians:
Gray, Asa. Letter to Charles Wilkes. 1848 September 27. Concerns payment for work on plants which will begin in November. Offers condolences on Wilkes bereavement. 2 pages.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This manuscript collection falls outside the geographic scope of the Early American guide (British North America and the United States before 1840). It may be of interest to scholars interested in global history, international relations, imperialism, or the U.S. in the world.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Cite as: Scientists Collection, American Philosophical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Scientists Collection is a miscellaneous assemblage of individual letters and small groups of correspondence of American and European scientists from the 17th through 20th centuries. The disciplines represented are varied, with significant depth in natural history, conchology, geology, and astronomy, and there are separate series for physicists (58 items, relating especially to Max Planck, and a further 28 for Enrico Fermi), and American-Russian scientific exchange prior to the Russian Revolution (46 items).

Among the more extensive sets of correspondence in the collection is an interesting group of letters dealing with conchology during the 19th and early 20th centuries. Consisting primarily of correspondence addressed to the naturalist, Otto Mörch, the clockmaker Benjamin Vulliamy, or the bookseller, Herman Lynge, this correspondence includes letters from avid devotees of the science such as A.D. Brown, F. L. Button, Alfred Newton, Christian M. Poulsen, Temple Prime, A.H. Riise, and A. G. Wetherby, concerning the acquisition and exchange of specimens in Britain and on the European continent. Much of the correspondence of the Americans Spencer Fullerton Baird, William Stimpson, and Theodore Lyman is of a similar nature.

The circle of Darwin and, more generally, of mid-19th century British natural historians, is also well represented in the Scientists Collection. Included in the collection are valuable letters from John Edward Gray, William Whewell, John Lubbock, and John Stevens Henslow, and there is a small set of letters from Robert Chambers, as well as a fascinating exchange between the publisher John Murray and the naturalist, Henry W. Bates, concerning publication of Bates' The Naturalist on the River Amazon and other works. Several of the great geologists of the glory days of the science are also represented, most only by a few letters, including Adam Sedgwick, Roderick Impey Murchison, John Phillips, William Buckland, Gideon Mantell, and Henry T. De La Beche.

The physical sciences form a third key area of interest, stretching from the 18th century astronomer, Baron von Zach, through Ferdinand Hassler and George Biddell Airy, to the correspondence of a graduate student, H.M. Cave, completing his doctoral studies at Cambridge in 1929. Series III includes correspondence of Arnold Sommerfeld, Wilhelm Wien, and Max Planck. Series IV includes Enrico Fermi's letters to Enrico Perisco.

A small number of miscellaneous autographs and brief letters of non-scientists has found their way into in the collection, having been acquired along with scientific correspondence. A few letters, most notably of Alfred Russel Wallace, have been transferred to other miscellaneous collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of correspondence relating to American and Russian scientific exchange prior to the Russian Revolution. The letters are a scattered and presumably incomplete representation of materials housed in the Akademiia Nauk S.S.S.R.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Original documents housed in the Akademiia Nauk S.S.S.R.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: St. Petersbourg, Photo.of L.S.: Jean Albert Euler. 2p. In French. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Notifies him of his election and praises him.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Académie imperiale des sciences de St. Petersbourg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: St. Petersbourg, Photo.of L.S.: Jean Albert Euler. 1p. In French. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Notifies him of his election.

did.unittitle: Letter to Académie Imperiale des Sciences de St. Petersbourg. President

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, Photo.of A.L.S. 2p.and add. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Concerning magnetism and longitude. Forwards his chart of variations of the compas.

did.unittitle: Letter to Académie Imperiale des Sciences de St. Petersbourg. President

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, Photo.of A.L.S. 4p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Concerning books sent to the APS. His work on the compas and variations on the compass.

did.unittitle: Letter to Struve, F. G. W. (Friedrich Georg Wilhelm), 1793-1864

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 3p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Questions figures in triangulations.

did.unittitle: Letter to Struve, F. G. W. (Friedrich Georg Wilhelm), 1793-1864

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Eng., Photo.of A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Has forwarded account of the triangulation of Great Britain.

did.unittitle: Letter to Struve, F. G. W. (Friedrich Georg Wilhelm), 1793-1864

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 5p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Triangulation.

did.unittitle: Letter to Struve, F. G. W. (Friedrich Georg Wilhelm), 1793-1864

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of L. 4p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow..) Determination of latitude and longitude Refers to Airy. Triangulation.

did.unittitle: Letter to Struve, F. G. W. (Friedrich Georg Wilhelm), 1793-1864

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 4p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Concerning the shipment of the standard bar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Since navigation to St. Petersburg is now closed, he expects they will not receive the standard bar until next spring.

did.unittitle: Letter to Académie imperiale des sciences de St. Petersbourg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Photo.of A.L.S. 1p.and end. (see Letters of Scientists, Moscow...) Thanks for being made a member. Refers to Euler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, Photo.of L. 1p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscwo...) Thanks to the Imperial Academy for having been made a member. Unlocated June 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 2p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Asks for error in the stardard bar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 4p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Variations on the bar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Thanks for the favor conferred on him by the academy of sciences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 6p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) His observations with the bars. Refers to Airy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, Photo.of A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Will ship publications, but would like direction for shipping.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photo.of A.L.S. 4p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Geodetic association. Pendulum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hastings, Photo.of A.L.S. 4p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Has been retired and needs extra income.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Halle, Ger., Photo. of A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Thanks for his publication and forwards one of his own.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Halle, Ger., Photo. of A.L.S. 2p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Forwards article on oriental writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Halle, Ger., Photo. of A.L.S. on postal card. 1p.and add. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Thanks for his publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Photo. of A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Thanks for his publication and forwards his own publication on oriental literature

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nice, Photo.of A.L.S. 2p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Tells him of a merchant in the city who has an oriental manuscript, but does not know the language.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Princeton, N. J., Photo.of A.L.S. 2p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Is delighted that he will visit the observatory at Princeton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Photo. of A.L.S. on postal card. 1p.and add. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Has just returned from Indian. Congratulates him on a publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Photo.of Printed and A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Dr. Jackson is on the way to Iran.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rostow, Photo.of A.L.S.on postal card. 1p.and add. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Enjoyed his stay in Persia and outlines his voyage to New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photo.of Typed L.S. 8p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Suggestions of plans for a southern hemisphere observatory for mapping the sky. Astronomical research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Albany, N.Y., Photo. of Typed L.S. 3p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Questions concerning the establishment of an observatory in the southern hemisphere.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, Photo.of A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Thanks for publications.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Académie imperiale des sciences de St. Petersbourg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: photo.of L.S.: Constantin. 1p. In French. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Congratulations on 200th anniversary of B.Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Yonkers, New York, Photo.of A.L.S. 2p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Thanks for his publication on Persian and praises it highly.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, Photo.of A.L.S. 1p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Thanks for his publications. Concerning astronomical problems.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: San Luis, Argentina, Photo.of A.L.S. 2p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Is working on establishing a southern hemisphere observatory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, Photo.of A.L.S. 4p. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Astronomy and astronomical problems.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Albany, N.Y., Photo of A.L.S. 4p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Enjoyed their visit. Astronomy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Photo.of A.L.S. 2p.and photo.of newspaper clipping. (see Letters of scientists Moscow...) Welcomes him to New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Albany, N.Y., Photo.of A.L.S. 2p, (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) Will forward mail to Tokyo. Enjoyed his visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photo.of A.L.S.on postal card. 1p.snd add. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Christmas greetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photo.of A.L.S. 3p. Incomplete. (see Letters of scientists. Moscow...) Hopes they can use the standard for some time. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Southampton, Photo.of A.L.S. 4p. (see Letters of Scientists. Moscow...) June 8. Will sends bars to Berlin. Asks for news of improved instruments for astronomical observations, pendulums, etc.

did.langmaterial: The majority of letters are written in German.
did.abstract: Max Planck is a particularly well-represented recipient and author of letters. Correspondents include Hans Thacher Clarke, Gerard Peter Kuiper, and Raymond John Seeger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and other materials relating primarily to Max Planck, Wilhelm Wien, and Arnold Sommerfeld. Some material formerly organized as Max Planck correspondence, 1919-1948, Mss.509.L56.p.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials presented by Hans T. Clarke, Nov. 1964 (1964 2512ms) and purchased at Stargardt sale, Nov. 24-5, 1964 (1964 2907ms).

bioghist.head: Background note
bioghist.p: Physicist Max Planck authored the quantum theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Halle, A.L. 5p. Describes flora and fauna located on trip with Captain Cook. Refers to various important scientists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Göttingen, A.L.S. 1p.and add.envelope. In German. Is giving up membership in the K.Gesellschaft der Wissenschaften, since he is unable to participate in scientific or business activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Winter]. A.L.S. 4p. In German. Concerning Röntgen's audience with Wilhelm II, with experiments. Details on how to duplicate the experiment. Details on the audience.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 2p. In German. Asks if he would like to edit the planned new edition of Mechanik, by G.R.Kirchhoff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Aachen, A.L.S. 4p. In German. Concerning work at the Polytechnikum. Mentions the laboratories and his experiments.

did.unittitle: New Year's Greetings, to Herrn & Frau Professor Dr. W. Wien, Würzburg

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Picture postal card, signed. 1p.and add. In German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. In German. Concerning objections of von Laue on Laub's work. Asks him to check against these objections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Witham, Essex, A.L.S. 2p. Comments on his treatment of Kelvin's problem and asks if he has carried it further.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Jena, A.L.S. 4p. In German. On the Nobel prize for Wien and Planck. Mentions Solvay Congress and the "Curie scandel" Personal news.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In German. Letter of condolence to Wien, at the death of his father-in-law.

did.unittitle: Letter to J. Laub, Buenos Aires, Argentina

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Würzburg, Typed L.S.on postal card. 1p.and add. In German. Received two photographic plates but the manuscript is missing. Suggests differing routes for each copy in the future.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 2p. In German. Thanks for his letter and the articles. Concerning a diamond which he thinks belongs to the Berliner Institut.

did.unittitle: Letter to Mrs. Frieda [Planck] Clarke, Rochester, N.Y.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 4p.and envelope addressed. In German. Thanks for congratulations. Talks about death of his daughter, Emma.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 2p. In German. On his and Planck's view of Einstein's theory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 7p. In German. Concerning the new Physikalisches Institut and his intended position there.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 5p. In German. Concerning the location, inventory and positions of the new physical institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 3p. In German. Concerning the planned physical institute and the possibility of his position there.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S.on postal card. 2p.,add. In German. Concerning erecting a new physical institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 2p. In German. Received note about optical resonance and will print it. Plans failed for the physical institute, because no suitable rooms were available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 4p. In German. Concerning the physical institutes in Munich and Berlin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Heidelberg, A.L.S. 4p. In German. Birthday greetings (60th). Praises the "Annalen." Will send article for the annals on surface tension.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. In German. (see Letters of Scientists - Physicists.) Birthday greetings on his 60th birthday. News of his son's marriage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In German. On vacation. Encloses article [article wanting]. Mentions meeting of Physikalische Gesellschaft in Innsbruck.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 1p. In German. Concerning Paschen and his position and work at the institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 4p. In German. Thanks for birthday greetings and pictures. Will visit Munich for opening of the Deutsche Museum. Household matters, friends, failure of plans for moving.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In German. Enclosing a work by Schrödinger. Has moved into a new home.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Zürich, A.L.S. 2p. Wishes to use his library to prepare a report for the National Research Council on "Discharge of Electricity through Gases."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Freiburg, A.L.S. 1p. In German. Orders "Grundserie..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 1p. In German. Regrets that Planck could not visit Kissingen. Concerning his latest travels and his work at the institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 4p. In German. Will stay at his house, if he comes to Berlin but is uncertain. Concerning manuscripts: physicists becoming so specialized they publish in special journals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Munich, A.L.S. 1p. In German. Encloses an article sent to him. Mentions his stay in Berlin. [Article wanting].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.in pencil. 1p. Draft. In German. Sends correction for lectures. Thanks for trouble over publication. Parcel from India not yet arrived. Friendly letter. On same sheet as Raman to Sommerfeld; May 5, 1929.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Calcutta Typed L.S. 1p. Forwards proofs of his Calcutta lectures. On same sheet is draft of Sommerfeld's reply; [June?, 1929].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Princeton, Typed L.S. 1p. Thanks him for correcting an error in an article by Dr. Harnwell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chicago, Typed L.S. 1p. Asks if Statuss may study with him and states the man's abilities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 1p. In German. Encloses a letter of recommendation to Pegram. [Enclosure wanted.]

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Debye, Peter J. W. (Peter Josef William), 1884-

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leipzig, Typed L.S. 1p. In German. Friendly letter, asking for another letter for request to the Rockefeller Foundation for grant.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Debye, Peter J. W. (Peter Josef William), 1884-

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S.on postal card. 1p.and add. In German. Asks for an invitation for Max von Angerer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, Typed L.S. 1p. Asks if he knows of any traces of Rumford's works in Munich. Friendly letter.

did.unittitle: Letter to Mr. and Mrs. Hans [Clarke]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 4p. In German. Thanks for birthday greetings. Cannot visit them. Itemizes lecture ture. Will represent Berliner Akademie der Wissenschaften at the Univ. of London's celebration. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 2p. In German. Thanks for birthday letter. Concerning his travels and plans for travelling. Still working for Kaiser-Wilhelm-Gesell-schaft and Akademie der Wissesschaften.

did.unittitle: Letter to Frau Hofrat Lampa, Vienna

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 2p.and add.envelope. In German. Letter of condolence to the widow of Anton Lamps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 2p. In German. Thanks for birthday letter. His recent travels. News of family.

did.unittitle: Letter to Mr. and Mrs. Hans Thacher Clarke, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 4p.and add.envelope. In German. Concerning the Clarke's 25th wedding anniversary. Travels in Europe. Family news.

did.unittitle: Letter to Hans [Thacher] Clarke, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S.on postal card. 1p. In German. Thanks for Christmas greetings and picture. News of family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Magdeburg, A.L.S. 2p. In German. To the widow of Wilhelm Wien, about the war. Air raids in Kassel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Goettingen, Typed L. 1p. Extract. (see Letters of scientists - Physicists) Concerning Max Planck.

did.unittitle: Letter to H[ans] T. Clark[e], New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Williams Bay, Wis., Typed L.S. 1p. Concerning Max Planck.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[erard] P. Kuiper, Williams Bay, Wisc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. Thanks for news of Max Planck.

did.unittitle: Letter to Mrs. [Frieda Planck] H. T. Clarke-Planck, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, Typed L.S. 1p.and add.envelope. Concerning Max Planck and encloses letter from him.

did.unittitle: Letter to Henry A. Barton, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed L. 1p. Carbon copy. Forwards Max Planck material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, A.L.S. 10. In German. Planck's memory failing. Difficult living conditions. Political conditions. Family affairs. Refugees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 4p. In German. Health of Hans and Frieda Clarke. Planck's memory failing. Family news and news of friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. In German. Looking forward to her visit. Wishes to remain in Göttingen (city of his ancestors) until he dies.

did.unittitle: Letter to Mrs. Frieda Planck Clarke, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, Typed L.S. 1p.and enclosure. Sends her the National Academy of Sciences statement in memory of Max Planck

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D. 11p. In German. Religion and science, especially since the new atomic theories.

did.unittitle: "Aerology. (Text of Maguire) Weather elements and their Observation."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A. D. 4p.

did.unittitle: Concerning cancer in mice caused by radioactive iron.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed D.31p. Incomplete.

did.abstract: These are letters and postcards on scientific and personal matters, with a long letter (1958) about Fermi's career from Adolfo Amidei to Emilio Segrè.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Predominately written in Italian. Formerly comprised the Enrico Fermi letters, 1918-1926, to Enrico Perisco, Mss.509.L56.p1. Fermi's letters are numbered (presumably by Persico or Segrè).

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: All material published in English in Segrè's biography of Fermi.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Emilio Segrè and accessioned, 1965.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a sketch of a barometer. Appears to be a fragment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On same sheet as 9 Dec. 1918, Fermi to Persico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On same sheet as 18 Aug. 1918, Fermi to Persico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 20 Mar. postscript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On same sheet as 26 July 1924, Fermi to Persico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On same sheet as 21 April 1923, Fermi to Persico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning Enrico Fermi.
